definition: to pick up (a theme etc)/to regain (confidence)/to revive (a custom, friendship etc)
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

sentences.english: I started to pick up my career months ago.
sentences.chinese: 我是在數月年重拾了自己的事業。

sentences.english: Duchovny and Anderson were asked about re-acclimating to their now iconic roles.
sentences.chinese: 杜楚尼和安德森被問及重拾這兩個偶像角色的問題。

sentences.english: Will Dell be able to regain back its leadership position in MSS?
sentences.chinese: 戴爾將能重拾回了其領先地位，在重建置業？

sentences.english: Believe that no matter in the class and grade work, or learning, you will be able to restore confidence.
sentences.chinese: 相信不管在班級工作，還是學習上，你定能重拾自信。

sentences.english: But that is because the tobacco industry have been up to their old tricks.
sentences.chinese: 但這是因爲菸草行業打算重拾舊把戲。

sentences.english: so I decided to come back.
sentences.chinese: 所以我下定決心重拾學業。

sentences.english: And when that heals, you'll be able to reacquire your powers.
sentences.chinese: 等你痊癒了，你就能重拾你的能力。

sentences.english: But Sam, having sallied forth, never returns to reclaim his love.
sentences.chinese: 不過遠走他鄉的山姆，從此再沒回來重拾舊愛。

sentences.english: To regain the happiness of childhood, like a treasure heart.
sentences.chinese: 重拾童年的美好，心靈無暇像塊寶。

sentences.english: So turn instead to the good old-fashioned exercise of calculating target prices.
sentences.chinese: 那麼還是重拾舊藝，好好計算計算個股的目標價位吧。
貝巴螚重拾弗格森的信任嗎？

sentences.english: Any day now, you expect to hear rumblings about bringing back the 55 mile-per-hour speed limit.
sentences.chinese: 最近美國或將重拾55英里限速規定的傳言比比皆是。

sentences.english: To change this situation, the most important move is to re-establish investors' confidence.
sentences.chinese: 要改變現狀，首當其衝的是重拾投資者的信心。

sentences.english: To be restored, then, you're going to have to have two things happening.
sentences.chinese: 若想重拾聖潔，必須做兩件事。

sentences.english: Thus hair-darkening is the answer to regain the shiny and healthy dark color look of vibrant hair outlook.
sentences.chinese: 因此染黑頭髮是重拾明亮及健康頭髮的答案。

sentences.english: And when we get stressed out, we go back to old habits.
sentences.chinese: 當我們沒有了壓力，我們就會重拾舊習。

definition: to waken (to action)/to rouse (the masses)/to evoke (attention, recollection etc)
(haven't done sth) for a long time/a long time since we last met
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
